lib.utils package¶

Submodules¶

lib.utils.data module¶

lib.utils.data.dataloader(data_path, columns, train_split, test_split=None, fillnan=True, filter_labels=None)¶

Read data from disk and concat values all togheter

Parameters

  • data_path (str) – Path to data directory

  • columns (list-like) – Columns that have to be read from csv files

  • train_split (str) – Filename suffix to use as train set

  • test_split (str) – Filename suffix to use as test set (can be None)

  • fillnan (bool) –

  • filter_labels (list-like) –

Returns

Two list [train/test] with dataframe and filename

Return type

List[Tuple[Dataframe, str]], List[Tuple[Dataframe, str]]

lib.utils.data.dataloader_single(data_path, columns, train_split, test_split=None, fillnan=True, filter_labels=None)¶

Read data from disk and return a list for each files with their name, it does not concat values all togheter

Parameters

  • data_path (str) – Path to data directory

  • columns (list-like) – Columns that have to be read from csv files

  • train_split (str) – Filename suffix to use as train set

  • test_split (str) – Filename suffix to use as test set (can be None)

  • fillnan (bool) –

  • filter_labels (list-like) –

Returns

Two list [train/test] with dataframe and filename

Return type

List[Tuple[Dataframe, str]], List[Tuple[Dataframe, str]]

lib.utils.data.label_mapping(y_data, known_labels)¶

Maps all class index to used one. It is possible to subsample number of classes.

Parameters

  • y_data (nd.array) – Array with labels to map

  • known_labels (list-like) – Labels index to map

Returns

label_map and y_data with cls_idx remapped

Return type

tuple(list, nd.array)

lib.utils.data.preprocessing(data, settings, log_dir, load_scaler=False, with_labels=False)¶
Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – Data array

  • settings (easydict or dict with dot attribute access) – Settings dictionary

  • log_dir (str) – Path where save scaler

  • load_scaler (bool) – Used to load or create a new scaler

  • with_labels (bool) – used to know if labels are used in the dataset or not

Returns

Scaler and two lists with train/test information

Return type

sklearn Scaler, List[np.ndarray, np.ndarray], List[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

lib.utils.data.read_dataset(data_path, columns, split, fillnan=True, filter_labels=None, verbose_name=None)¶
Parameters

  • data_path (str) – Path to dataset directory

  • columns (list-like) – Columns that have to be read from csv files

  • split (str) – A string to identify if it is a training/validation/test split

  • fillnan (bool) – Replace NaN values with 0.0 or not

  • filter_labels (list-like) – Preserves rows with declared labels

  • verbose_name (str) – Output name during loading operation

Returns

Array with size (number_of_samples, number_of_columns)

Return type

Pandas DataFrame

lib.utils.data.read_dataset_list(data_path, columns, split, fillnan=True, filter_labels=None, verbose_name=None)¶

Read dataset and return a list of dataframes with associated filename.

Parameters

  • data_path (str) – Path to dataset directory

  • columns (list-like) – Columns that have to be read from csv files

  • split (str) – A string to identify if it is a training/validation/test split

  • fillnan (bool) – Replace NaN values with 0.0 or not

  • filter_labels (list-like) – Preserves rows with declared labels

  • verbose_name (str) – Output name during loading operation

Returns

A list of arrays of shape (number_of_samples, all_columns) and filenames

Return type

(list of Pandas DataFrame, str)

lib.utils.data.split_labels(data, label_idx=- 1)¶

Split labels from numerical data

Parameters

  • data (nd.array) – array of inputs data

  • label_idx (int) – index where label is located in the array. It can be only at start of at the end of the array

Returns

data without labels, labels

Return type

nd.array, nd.array

lib.utils.model module¶

lib.utils.model.evaluate(model, test_data, with_labels=False)¶

Function to evaluate trained models

Parameters

  • model (tf.keras.Model) – Tensorflow model

  • test_data (np.ndarray | tf.data.dataset) – Data to test on model

  • with_labels (bool) – A value to indicate if labels are present in data or not

Returns

None

lib.utils.model.train(model, train_data, settings, log_dir, with_labels=False)¶

Function used to train the model, it is able to save training stats and model checkpoint

Parameters

  • model (tf.keras.Model) – Tensorflow model

  • train_data (np.ndarray | tf.data.dataset) – Training data

  • settings (easydict or dictionary with attribute dot access) – Model settings

  • log_dir (str) – Path where save model checkpoints and training stats

  • with_labels (bool) – A value to indicate if labels are present in data or not

Returns

None

lib.utils.weather module¶

lib.utils.weather.evaluate_and_store(records, set_type, model, x_scaler, label_map, log_dir, filter_labels)¶

Evaluate model on weather pattern on a list of data. It automatically save a new file with two new columns one with classification numeric result and another with classification label name

Parameters

  • records (List[Dataframe]) – A list of dataframe

  • set_type (str) – Name to associate with output_file (train|test)

  • model (tf.keras.Model) – Tensorflow model

  • x_scaler (sklearn Scaler) – Scaler used in training process

  • label_map (dict) – Label to associate with output

  • log_dir (str) – Path to directory where save output files

  • filter_labels (list-like) – Columns to use in estimation process

Returns

None
